result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler L Gerber

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler L Gerber appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Tyler L Gerber.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs to complete the firearm safety class and the essay in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Tyler Gerber Community service

Defendant Tyler L Gerber appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Tyler L Gerber.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has completed all of the hours of the community service. Court orders by September 23rd, 2022, defense counsel needs to contact ADA Anthony White to schedule a staffing to address the firearm safety course. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Tyler L Gerber in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler L Gerber appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense provides update to the court. Defendant not able to connect with J. Vance. Case to be staffed. Case adjourned for Review Hearing.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Defendant Tyler L Gerber in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Defendant appears Remotely. Defense counsel appears in person.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.
 
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler L Gerber in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and possible DPA offer and requests an adjournment. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.

This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyler L Gerber in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/22 @ 2:30p
